title: Ballistics Engineer
description:
About the job
Ballistics Engineer
Fulda, Germany
€70,000 - €120,000
Our client, a leading and innovative company specializing in high-performance protection solutions based in Fulda, Germany, is seeking a dedicated and skilled Technician for Hard Ballistics. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development and production of advanced protective materials for a critical industry.
In this role, the successful candidate will be instrumental in the creation and processing of hard ballistic components, primarily plates or "tiles" made from metal, advanced compounds, and ceramics. The technician will work hands-on with these materials, applying their technical expertise to ensure the highest standards of quality and performance.
Key responsibilities may include:
Working with various metallic materials and understanding their properties in ballistic applications.
Handling and processing composite materials used in conjunction with hard ballistic elements.
Mixing and handling ceramic materials and compounds, adhering to strict safety protocols.
Operating and maintaining equipment used in the production and testing of hard ballistic materials.
Ensuring adherence to quality control procedures and documentation standards.
Collaborating with engineers and other technical staff to optimize production processes and product performance.
Contributing to the development and improvement of manufacturing techniques for hard ballistic solutions.
The ideal candidate will possess:
A completed vocational training or technical education in a relevant field such as materials science, ceramics, metalworking, or a related discipline.
Practical experience working with metals, composites, and/or ceramics. Experience in industries where ceramics have a safety-critical aspect (e.g., aerospace, tactical vehicles) is highly advantageous.
A strong technical aptitude and a hands-on approach to problem-solving.
A meticulous approach to work with a strong focus on quality and safety.
The ability to follow instructions and work effectively within a team.
A willingness to learn and develop new skills in the field of hard ballistics.
Fluency in English is essential.
This is a unique opportunity to join a company at the forefront of protection technology and contribute to the creation of life-saving solutions. If you have a passion for materials science and are looking for a challenging and rewarding role in the Fulda region, we encourage you to apply.
To express your interest in this position, please submit your application.

We offer end-to-end support, from Statements of Work and IR35 determination processes to full MSP and RPO models.

In today's fast-changing business environment, companies need a recruitment partner who understands. At iO, we host iO Meetups and conferences in the tech and digital sector, working closely with our clients to stay ahead of the curve and connect with top candidates.

As part of Precision Resource Group (PRG), we have been acknowledged for our impressive growth and success, with PRG listed in the 24th annual Sunday Times Virgin Atlantic Fast Track 100 as one of Britain's fastest-growing private companies. We have also been finalists at the Bristol Life Awards 2022 and Business Leader Awards 2022 and were recently ranked in WIRED Consulting's Top 15 Trail Blazers in the South West, recognising our exceptional approach to recruitment.

We are members of the Employers Network For Equality & Inclusion (ENEI), promoting best practices in equality and inclusion in the workplace for our employees, clients, and candidates. We are Disability Confident and members of Programme One, working to tackle workplace inequality for black talent in the recruitment industry.

title: WTG loads engineer
description:
About the job
We are looking for WTG load engineers to join our LOADS Team focused on Wind Turbine Generator Studies.

Main tasks:
-Develop loads focused technical solutions and technologies, methods, models and tools, validating them and deploying to Products
-Contribute to the definition of the functional characteristics of the wind turbine
-Develop wind turbine simulation models for aeroelastic calculation
-Determine the dynamics and loads of wind turbines in each subsystem for definition of loads
related technical solutions
-Contribute to the definition of control, operation and safety strategies of wind turbine
-Define the requirements for the validation and testing of loads, provide support during the tests
and perform the analysis of the results
-Carry out the correlation and updating of the wind turbine aeroelastic models

Technical qualifications needed:
-Engineering MSc or PhD within Aerospace, Mechanical Engineering or similar.
-Solid theoretical background in wind turbine loads and aeroelasticity
-Proven experience with loads related models and tools, as aeroelastic code (BHawC, HAWC,
Bladed, FAST, NEREA, FLEX5, etc.), pre and post processing tools, aeroelastic stability tools, etc.,
capabilities and limitations
-Excellent analytical skills and understanding of aeroservoelastic design principles
-Experience with technology development and innovation
-Pro-active coming up with new ideas for improving loads simulation technology (solutions, process, models, tools, etc.)
-Solid language skills in English (written and spoken min level B2)

Following skills would be a plus:
-Knowledge of aerodynamics, structural design and control
-Experience with MATLAB, Python, etc.
-Written and Spoken Spanish (B1)

Benefits:
Training Plan
Flexible remuneration plan (exemptions from Personal Income Tax)

title: Documentation AIT Engineer (all genders)
description:
About the job
Join the Pinnacle of Satellite Technology Advancement in Germany!

Reflex Aerospace is at the forefront of propelling high-performance satellite technology to new heights within the German aerospace landscape.

As part of Reflex Aerospace, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the trajectory of the space industry's future. This is an opportunity to contribute your expertise and enthusiasm to a team that stands for innovation and excellence. If you are ready to take on exciting challenges and be part of a company that is redefining the boundaries of satellite technology, we welcome you to embark on this thrilling journey with us!

Your Mission

Maintain, create, and update technical documentation, such as work instructions, test protocols, and test reports.
Manage and utilize the MES system (Manufacturo) to control and document manufacturing and integration processes.
Maintain bill of materials (BOMs), track component statuses, and link technical documents within the system.
Support the preparation and follow-up of integration steps by providing the correct documentation and tools in the MES.
Assist the AIT (Assembly, Integration, and Testing) team in the mechanical integration of aerospace components or complex assemblies.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of processes and templates in the area of AIT documentation.

Your Background

University degree in Aerospace Engineering or a related field, or equivalent professional experience
Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in documentation, manufacturing processes, or technical assistance in assembly/integration
Prior experience with an MES system, preferably Manufacturo or a comparable system
Technical understanding of mechanical components and assemblies
Structured and meticulous working style with a strong affinity for process documentation and digital systems
Team-oriented with flexibility and resilience
Excellent command of English, both written and spoken
Hands-on mentality

What We Offer

Collaborate with a diverse multinational team crafting the next wave of cutting-edge satellites. Embark on this exciting journey with us from the outset, leaving your indelible mark on a dynamic company and playing a direct role in shaping the future of the space industry. 
Keep your energy levels high with company-sponsored memberships for Urban Sports Club and Swapfiets. 
We provide a hybrid work model along with flexible working hours, empowering you as the owner of your time management. 
Enjoy the flexibility of ample vacation time, including a special company holiday on April 12th dedicated to celebrating the International Day of Human Spaceflight.

Join Reflex Aerospace and be a driving force in shaping the next era of space exploration!

We look for your application.

About Us

Reflex Aerospace, a NewSpace startup founded in 2021 and headquartered in Munich and Berlin, has been leading the charge to provide advanced dual-use satellite technology at unparalleled speed. The company is leveraging the latest techniques to modernize payload-centric satellite development and production, achieving significantly faster delivery times and enhanced reliability. By applying algorithmic engineering and streamlined system design processes, Reflex accelerates the delivery of satellites enabling lightning-fast innovation for our customers.

title: Junior Flight Test Engineer (m/f/x)
description:
About the job
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Your work will directly support the future of aviation by ensuring that every test flight is prepared, executed, and documented to the highest standards.
You will take responsibility for the design and layout of flight test equipment, bridging the gap between concept and reality and supporting hands-on installation.
Calibrating, preprocessing, and postprocessing crucial test data will be just as much a part of your daily work as organizing and preparing briefings and debriefings for each flight test mission.
You will create, manage, and update all test documentation, take ownership of configuration control, and ensure smooth administration of all technical changes. You will be a key part of a high-performance, international test team.

QUALIFICATIONS
Ideally, you bring first experiences in flight testing or have worked in shop floor or aircraft component environments.
Flying experience is beneficial, but not required.
You are familiar with Python, Matlab or similar programming languages, and ideally you have experience with NI flight test equipment such as the Curtiss-Wright KAM-500 or SSR.
Above all, you are a proactive problem-solver who enjoys responsibility, ownership, and collaboration. You think conceptually, work independently, and are committed to team success.

We are a dynamic family-owned company with short decision-making processes and open doors. Additionally, we offer:
40-hour workweek, 30 days of vacation, company pension plan & a secure workplace
"Work-life balance" – harmonizing career and family
A relaxed work atmosphere with open and respectful leadership
We look forward to receiving your 1-click application via the LinkedIn Easy Apply button above

About the company
H3 Grob Aircraft SE
6,827 followers
Follow
Aviation and Aerospace Component Manufacturing 201-500 employees 138 on LinkedIn
Grob Aircraft was founded in 1971 and established itself in the gliding industry over the years. Since 2009, we have been developing and manufacturing training aircraft made of carbon fiber composite materials for civil and military pilot training. Headquartered in Mattsies-Tussenhausen in the picturesque Unterallgäu region, we are the only company in Germany that produces aircraft entirely at one location.

Our aim is to be the leading company in our market segment. We strive not only to produce state-of-the-art aircraft, but also to offer a comprehensive training system. This includes state-of-the-art simulators, computer based learning systems, pilot selection and evaluation system and VR simulation technology.

We have a family working environment with flat hierarchies and a culture of collaboration. It is important to us that our employees feel comfortable in an environment that encourages innovation and personal growth.

Our mission is not only to build airplanes, but also to equip the next generation of pilots with the necessary skills and technology to succeed in aviation. With a clear focus on quality, innovation and customer satisfaction, we strive to push the boundaries of what is possible in aircraft manufacturing and pilot training.

We invite you to become part of our success story and join us in shaping the future of aviation.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
About the job
At Tetra Pak we commit to making food safe and available, everywhere; and we protect what's good – protecting food, protecting people, and protecting the planet. By doing so we touch millions of people's lives every day. 

And we need people like you to make it happen.

We empower you to reach your potential with opportunities to make an impact to be proud of – for food, people and the planet.

Job Summary

We are looking for a Mechanical engineer at Tetra Pak Ice Cream Solutions - the world’s leading supplier of equipment and production lines for the ice cream industry - with solid competences or strong interest in mechanical systems as well as solid competences in mechanical engineering.

As a Mechanical Engineer at Tetra Pak, you will execute on engineering tasks associated with engineering projects and customized solutions to the ice cream industry. You will become part of an international leading company, where you will have a dynamic working day in close collaboration with colleagues across the organization.

The position is based in Edertal, Germany, with a travel activity of 60-90 days per annum, mainly to Aarhus, Denmark, for support.

What You Will Do

Mechanical development, design, and review of technical solutions, including structural and mechanical systems for Ice Cream machinery in close collaboration with your colleagues in the team in Edertal (DE), as well as our colleagues in Aarhus, DK
Calculate and specify mechanical systems and components 
Create 3D design, assembling and part drawings, in Creo / Windchill and evaluate a design in the terms of safety, functionality, cost, Design for Manufacturing (DFM), Design for Serviceability (DFS), Verification and Validation etc. by utilizing a system approach that simultaneously considers all the design goals and constraints for the product.
Manage customer projects in collaboration with our colleagues in Denmark and globally, and support them also by personally visiting if necessary
Deliver innovative ideas by examining alternate techniques/approaches
Support sales with customized solutions, specifications, and cost calculations
Lead and solve tasks by being analytical and having a structured and systematic approach
Troubleshooting and Problem-solving activities 

We believe you have

Professional Skills

Bachelor's or master’s degree in engineering with experience, where we prefer some specialist knowledge and competences within mechanical systems 

or

Mechanical Engineer degree with comprehensive experience in comparable design tasks
Competences in calculating and creating 3D designs of mechanical systems and components
Extensive material knowledge and insight into metalworking/manufacturing processes, enabling you to make the right choices already in the design phase
Experience in the food and dairy industry is an advantage
Familiar with Creo / Windchill
Familiar with ERP systems (SAP) advantageous
Good German and English skills, both oral and written 

Personal Skills

You are a team player who is flexible in his thinking and can create collaboration across the organization, both internally and externally
You are trustworthy, collaborative, and contribute to an open forum for knowledge sharing among you and your colleagues
At the same time, you are motivated by responsibility, a high professional level, complex issues, and by solving these together
You always strive for high quality and know how to convey your results and your professional knowledge visibly to customers and colleagues
Currently you are eligible to work in Germany (main) as well as Denmark (approx.60-90 days)

We Offer You

A variety of exciting challenges with ample opportunities for development and training in a truly global landscape
A culture that pioneers a spirit of innovation where our industry experts drive visible results
An equal opportunity employment experience that values diversity and inclusion
Market competitive compensation and benefits with flexible working arrangements

Apply Now

If you are inspired to be part of our promise to protect what’s good; for food, people, and the planet, apply through our careers page at https://jobs.tetrapak.com/.

This job posting expires on 24 June.

Diversity, equity, and inclusion is an everyday part of how we work. We give people a place to belong and support to thrive, an environment where everyone can be comfortable being themselves and has equal opportunities to grow and succeed. We embrace difference, celebrate people for who they are, and for the diversity they bring that helps us better understand and connect with our customers and communities worldwide.

About the company
Tetra Pak
934,877 followers

Packaging and Containers Manufacturing 10,001+ employees 25,360 on LinkedIn
We are specialists in complete solutions for the processing, packaging and distribution of food products. Dairy products, juices and nectars, ice cream, cheese, dry foods, fruits, vegetables and pet food are examples of products that can be processed or packaged in Tetra Pak® processing and packaging lines. We focus on keeping the consumption of all raw materials and energy to a minimum during both the manufacturing process and distribution. The processing solutions are also designed to treat the products gently.

Our products are divided into several categories:
- Packages
- Processing equipment
- Filling machines
- Distribution equipment
- Service products


LinkedIn Community Guidelines for Tetra Pak

As part of our commitment to you we will endeavour to ensure that the content on this page is positive and respectful. In doing so we ask that you respect our LinkedIn page guidelines.

These guidelines also apply to all company spokespeople.

While we welcome any posts and comments, it’s important to note that postings to the Tetra Pak LinkedIn page, from other users, are not representative of the opinions of Tetra Pak, therefore do we not confirm their accuracy.

Since we can't monitor every posting or conversation, we realise that the occasional objectionable post will pop up from time to time. We therefore reserve the right to remove posts or comments that are:

- Abusive, defamatory, obscene, or offensive
- Fraudulent, deceptive, misleading, or unlawful
- Hateful in language targeting race/ethnicity, religion, gender, nationality, or political beliefs
- In violation of any intellectual property right
- Sales pitches or commercial solicitation
- Not being relevant to the topic or content in the post that has been published
- Spamming or link baiting
